name: postgresql
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing postgresql cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`postgresql` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/cyrilgdn/terraform-provider-postgresql).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing postgresql cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/cyrilgdn/terraform-provider-postgresql)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-postgresql` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-postgresql/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-postgresql` repo](https://github.com/cyrilgdn/terraform-provider-postgresql/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/cyrilgdn/terraform-provider-postgresql)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-postgresql` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-postgresql/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-postgresql` repo](https://github.com/cyrilgdn/terraform-provider-postgresql/issues).

awsRdsIamAuth.description: Use rds_iam instead of password authentication (see: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/UsingWithRDS.IAMDBAuth.html)

awsRdsIamProfile.description: AWS profile to use for IAM auth

awsRdsIamProviderRoleArn.description: AWS IAM role to assume for IAM auth

awsRdsIamRegion.description: AWS region to use for IAM auth

azureIdentityAuth.description: Use MS Azure identity OAuth token (see: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/postgresql/flexible-server/how-to-configure-sign-in-azure-ad-authentication)

clientcert.description: SSL client certificate if required by the database.

connectTimeout.description: Maximum wait for connection, in seconds. Zero or not specified means wait indefinitely.

database.description: The name of the database to connect to in order to connect to (defaults to `postgres`).

databaseUsername.description: Database username associated to the connected user (for user name maps)

expectedVersion.description: Specify the expected version of PostgreSQL.

gcpIamImpersonateServiceAccount.description: Service account to impersonate when using GCP IAM authentication.

host.description: Name of PostgreSQL server address to connect to

maxConnections.description: Maximum number of connections to establish to the database. Zero means unlimited.

password.description: Password to be used if the PostgreSQL server demands password authentication

port.description: The PostgreSQL port number to connect to at the server host, or socket file name extension for Unix-domain connections

sslmode.description: This option determines whether or with what priority a secure SSL TCP/IP connection will be negotiated with the PostgreSQL server

sslrootcert.description: The SSL server root certificate file path. The file must contain PEM encoded data.

superuser.description: Specify if the user to connect as is a Postgres superuser or not.If not, some feature might be disabled (e.g.: Refreshing state password from Postgres)

username.description: PostgreSQL user name to connect as

cert.description: The SSL client certificate file path. The file must contain PEM encoded data.

key.description: The SSL client certificate private key file path. The file must contain PEM encoded data.

sslinline.description: Must be set to true if you are inlining the cert/key instead of using a file path.

default.description: An expression to be used as default value if the parameter is not specified.

mode.description: Can be one of IN, INOUT, OUT, or VARIADIC. Default is IN.

name.description: The name of the argument.

cert.description: The SSL client certificate file path. The file must contain PEM encoded data.

key.description: The SSL client certificate private key file path. The file must contain PEM encoded data.

sslinline.description: Must be set to true if you are inlining the cert/key instead of using a file path.

create.description: Should the specified ROLE have CREATE privileges to the specified SCHEMA.

createWithGrant.description: Should the specified ROLE have CREATE privileges to the specified SCHEMA and the ability to GRANT the CREATE privilege to other ROLEs.

role.description: The ROLE who is receiving the policy.  If this value is empty or not specified it implies the policy is referring to the [`PUBLIC` role](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/sql-grant.html).

usage.description: Should the specified ROLE have USAGE privileges to the specified SCHEMA.

usageWithGrant.description:
Should the specified ROLE have USAGE privileges to the specified SCHEMA and the ability to GRANT the USAGE privilege to other ROLEs.

> **NOTE on `policy`:** The permissions of a role specified in multiple policy blocks is cumulative.  For example, if the same role is specified in two different `policy` each with different permissions (e.g. `create` and `usage_with_grant`, respectively), then the specified role with have both `create` and `usage_with_grant` privileges.

dataType.description: The sequence's data type as defined in ``information_schema.sequences``.

tableType.description: The table type as defined in ``information_schema.tables``.

provider.description:
The provider type for the postgresql package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

host.description: Name of PostgreSQL server address to connect to

maxConnections.description: Maximum number of connections to establish to the database. Zero means unlimited.

password.description: Password to be used if the PostgreSQL server demands password authentication

port.description: The PostgreSQL port number to connect to at the server host, or socket file name extension for Unix-domain connections

username.description: PostgreSQL user name to connect as

allowConnections.description:
If `false` then no one can connect to this
database. The default is `true`, allowing connections (except as restricted by
other mechanisms, such as `GRANT` or `REVOKE CONNECT`).

alterObjectOwnership.description:
If `true`, the change of the database
`owner` will also include a reassignment of the ownership of preexisting
objects like tables or sequences from the previous owner to the new one.
If set to `false` (the default), then the previous database `owner` will still
hold the ownership of the objects in that database. To alter existing objects in
the database, you must be a direct or indirect member of the specified role, or
the username in the provider must be superuser.

connectionLimit.description:
How many concurrent connections can be
established to this database. `-1` (the default) means no limit.

encoding.description: Character set encoding to use in the new database

isTemplate.description:
If `true`, then this database can be cloned by any
user with `CREATEDB` privileges; if `false` (the default), then only
superusers or the owner of the database can clone it.

lcCollate.description: Collation order (LC_COLLATE) to use in the new database

lcCtype.description: Character classification (LC_CTYPE) to use in the new database

name.description:
The name of the database. Must be unique on the PostgreSQL
server instance where it is configured.

owner.description:
The role name of the user who will own the database, or
`DEFAULT` to use the default (namely, the user executing the command). To
create a database owned by another role or to change the owner of an existing
database, you must be a direct or indirect member of the specified role, or
the username in the provider is a superuser.

tablespaceName.description:
The name of the tablespace that will be
associated with the database, or `DEFAULT` to use the template database's
tablespace.  This tablespace will be the default tablespace used for objects
created in this database.

template.description: The name of the template from which to create the new database

If `false` then no one can connect to this
database. The default is `true`, allowing connections (except as restricted by
other mechanisms, such as `GRANT` or `REVOKE CONNECT`).

`owner` will also include a reassignment of the ownership of preexisting
objects like tables or sequences from the previous owner to the new one.
If set to `false` (the default), then the previous database `owner` will still
hold the ownership of the objects in that database. To alter existing objects in
the database, you must be a direct or indirect member of the specified role, or
the username in the provider must be superuser.

How many concurrent connections can be
established to this database. `-1` (the default) means no limit.

encoding.description: Character set encoding to use in the new database

isTemplate.description:
If `true`, then this database can be cloned by any
user with `CREATEDB` privileges; if `false` (the default), then only
superusers or the owner of the database can clone it.

database.description: The database to grant default privileges for this role.

objectType.description: The PostgreSQL object type to set the default privileges on (one of: table, sequence, function, routine, type, schema).

owner.description: Specifies the role that creates objects for which the default privileges will be applied.

privileges.description: List of privileges (e.g., SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE) to grant on new objects created by the owner. An empty list could be provided to revoke all default privileges for this role.

role.description: The role that will automatically be granted the specified privileges on new objects created by the owner.

schema.description: The database schema to set default privileges for this role.

withGrantOption.description: Permit the grant recipient to grant it to others

createCascade.description: When true, will also create any extensions that this extension depends on that are not already installed. (Default: false)

database.description: Which database to create the extension on. Defaults to provider database.

dropCascade.description: When true, will also drop all the objects that depend on the extension, and in turn all objects that depend on those objects. (Default: false)

name.description: The name of the extension.

schema.description: Sets the schema of an extension.

version.description: Sets the version number of the extension.

args.description: List of arguments for the function.

body.description:
Function body.
This should be the body content within the `AS $$` and the final `$$`. It will also accept the `AS $$` and `$$` if added.

database.description:
The database where the function is located.
If not specified, the function is created in the current database.

dropCascade.description:
True to automatically drop objects that depend on the function (such as
operators or triggers), and in turn all objects that depend on those objects. Default is false.

language.description: The function programming language. Can be one of internal, sql, c, plpgsql. Default is plpgsql.

name.description: The name of the function.

parallel.description: Indicates if the function is parallel safe. Can be one of UNSAFE, RESTRICTED, or SAFE. Default is UNSAFE.

returns.description: Type that the function returns. It can be computed from the OUT arguments. Default is void.

schema.description:
The schema where the function is located.
If not specified, the function is created in the current schema.

securityDefiner.description: If the function should execute with the permissions of the owner, rather than the permissions of the caller. Default is false.

strict.description: If the function should always return NULL when any of the inputs is NULL. Default is false.

volatility.description: Defines the volatility of the function. Can be one of VOLATILE, STABLE, or IMMUTABLE. Default is VOLATILE.

args.description: List of arguments for the function.

Function body.
This should be the body content within the `AS $$` and the final `$$`. It will also accept the `AS $$` and `$$` if added.

database.description:

If not specified, the function is created in the current database.

True to automatically drop objects that depend on the function (such as
operators or triggers), and in turn all objects that depend on those objects. Default is false.

strict.description: If the function should always return NULL when any of the inputs is NULL. Default is false.

columns.description: The columns upon which to grant the privileges. Required when `object_type` is `column`. You cannot specify this option if the `object_type` is not `column`.

database.description: The database to grant privileges on for this role.

objectType.description: The PostgreSQL object type to grant the privileges on (one of: database, schema, table, sequence, function, procedure, routine, foreign_data_wrapper, foreign_server, column).

objects.description: The objects upon which to grant the privileges. An empty list (the default) means to grant permissions on *all* objects of the specified type. You cannot specify this option if the `object_type` is `database` or `schema`. When `object_type` is `column`, only one value is allowed.

privileges.description: The list of privileges to grant. There are different kinds of privileges: SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, TRUNCATE, REFERENCES, TRIGGER, CREATE, CONNECT, TEMPORARY, EXECUTE, and USAGE. An empty list could be provided to revoke all privileges for this role.

role.description: The name of the role to grant privileges on, Set it to "public" for all roles.

schema.description: The database schema to grant privileges on for this role (Required except if object_type is "database")

withGrantOption.description: Whether the recipient of these privileges can grant the same privileges to others. Defaults to false.

database.description: The database to grant privileges on for this role.

role.description: The name of the role to grant privileges on, Set it to "public" for all roles.

schema.description: The database schema to grant privileges on for this role (Required except if object_type is "database")

name.description: The name of the replication slot.
The name of the replication slot.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering PhysicalReplicationSlot resources.

name.description: The name of the replication slot.

allTables.description: Should be ALL TABLES added to the publication. Defaults to 'false'

database.description: Which database to create the publication on. Defaults to provider database.

dropCascade.description: Should all subsequent resources of the publication be dropped. Defaults to 'false'

name.description: The name of the publication.

owner.description: Who owns the publication. Defaults to provider user.

publishParams.description: Which 'publish' options should be turned on. Default to 'insert','update','delete'

publishViaPartitionRootParam.description: Should be option 'publish_via_partition_root' be turned on. Default to 'false'

tables.description: Which tables add to the publication. By defaults no tables added. Format of table is `<schema_name>.<table_name>`. If `<schema_name>` is not specified - default database schema will be used.  Table string must be listed in alphabetical order.

dropCascade.description: Should all subsequent resources of the publication be dropped. Defaults to 'false'

name.description: The name of the publication.

owner.description: Who owns the publication. Defaults to provider user.

publishViaPartitionRootParam.description: Should be option 'publish_via_partition_root' be turned on. Default to 'false'

assumeRole.description: Defines the role to switch to at login via [`SET ROLE`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/sql-set-role.html).

bypassRowLevelSecurity.description:
Defines whether a role bypasses every
row-level security (RLS) policy.  Default value is `false`.

connectionLimit.description:
If this role can log in, this specifies how
many concurrent connections the role can establish. `-1` (the default) means no
limit.

createDatabase.description:
Defines a role's ability to execute `CREATE
DATABASE`.  Default value is `false`.

createRole.description:
Defines a role's ability to execute `CREATE ROLE`.
A role with this privilege can also alter and drop other roles.  Default value
is `false`.

encrypted.deprecationMessage: Rename PostgreSQL role resource attribute "encrypted" to "encrypted_password"

encryptedPassword.description:
Defines whether the password is stored
encrypted in the system catalogs.  Default value is `true`.  NOTE: this value
is always set (to the conservative and safe value), but may interfere with the
behavior of
[PostgreSQL's `password_encryption` setting](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/runtime-config-connection.html#GUC-PASSWORD-ENCRYPTION).

idleInTransactionSessionTimeout.description: Terminate any session with an open transaction that has been idle for longer than the specified duration in milliseconds

inherit.description:
Defines whether a role "inherits" the privileges of
roles it is a member of.  Default value is `true`.

login.description:
Defines whether role is allowed to log in.  Roles without
this attribute are useful for managing database privileges, but are not users
in the usual sense of the word.  Default value is `false`.

name.description:
The name of the role. Must be unique on the PostgreSQL
server instance where it is configured.

password.description:
Sets the role's password. A password is only of use
for roles having the `login` attribute set to true.

passwordWoVersion.description:
Prevents applies from updating the role password on every
apply unless the value changes. This version string should be updated whenever you want to
change the password specified in `password_wo`. Must be used together with `password_wo`.
Conflicts with `password`.

replication.description:
Defines whether a role is allowed to initiate
streaming replication or put the system in and out of backup mode.  Default
value is `false`

roles.description: Defines list of roles which will be granted to this new role.

searchPaths.description:
Alters the search path of this new role. Note that
due to limitations in the implementation, values cannot contain the substring
`", "`.

skipDropRole.description:
When a PostgreSQL ROLE exists in multiple
databases and the ROLE is dropped, the
[cleanup of ownership of objects](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/role-removal.html)
in each of the respective databases must occur before the ROLE can be dropped
from the catalog.  Set this option to true when there are multiple databases
in a PostgreSQL cluster using the same PostgreSQL ROLE for object ownership.
This is the third and final step taken when removing a ROLE from a database.

skipReassignOwned.description:
When a PostgreSQL ROLE exists in multiple
databases and the ROLE is dropped, a
[`REASSIGN OWNED`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/sql-reassign-owned.html) in
must be executed on each of the respective databases before the `DROP ROLE`
can be executed to drop the ROLE from the catalog.  This is the first and
second steps taken when removing a ROLE from a database (the second step being
an implicit
[`DROP OWNED`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/sql-drop-owned.html)).

statementTimeout.description: Defines [`statement_timeout`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/runtime-config-client.html#RUNTIME-CONFIG-CLIENT-STATEMENT) setting for this role which allows to abort any statement that takes more than the specified amount of time.

superuser.description:
Defines whether the role is a "superuser", and
therefore can override all access restrictions within the database.  Default
value is `false`.

validUntil.description:
Defines the date and time after which the role's
password is no longer valid.  Established connections past this `valid_time`
will have to be manually terminated.  This value corresponds to a PostgreSQL
datetime. If omitted or the magic value `NULL` is used, `valid_until` will be
set to `infinity`.  Default is `NULL`, therefore `infinity`.

assumeRole.description: Defines the role to switch to at login via [`SET ROLE`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/sql-set-role.html).

bypassRowLevelSecurity.description:
Defines whether a role bypasses every
row-level security (RLS) policy.  Default value is `false`.

connectionLimit.description:
If this role can log in, this specifies how
many concurrent connections the role can establish. `-1` (the default) means no
limit.

DATABASE`.  Default value is `false`.

createRole.description:
Defines a role's ability to execute `CREATE ROLE`.
A role with this privilege can also alter and drop other roles.  Default value
is `false`.

database.description: The DATABASE in which where this schema will be created. (Default: The database used by your `provider` configuration)

dropCascade.description: When true, will also drop all the objects that are contained in the schema. (Default: false)

ifNotExists.description: When true, use the existing schema if it exists. (Default: true)

name.description:
The name of the schema. Must be unique in the PostgreSQL
database instance where it is configured.

owner.description: The ROLE who owns the schema.

policies.description:
Can be specified multiple times for each policy.  Each
policy block supports fields documented below.

database.description: The DATABASE in which where this schema will be created. (Default: The database used by your `provider` configuration)

dropCascade.description: When true, will also drop all the objects that are contained in the schema. (Default: false)

ifNotExists.description: When true, use the existing schema if it exists. (Default: true)

name.description:
The name of the schema. Must be unique in the PostgreSQL
database instance where it is configured.

owner.description: The ROLE who owns the schema.

policies.description:
Can be specified multiple times for each policy.  Each
policy block supports fields documented below.

ifNotExists.description: When true, use the existing schema if it exists. (Default: true)

database instance where it is configured.

owner.description: The ROLE who owns the schema.

policies.description:

policy block supports fields documented below.

label.description: The value of the security label.

labelProvider.description: The name of the provider with which this label is to be associated.

objectName.description: The name of the object to be labeled. Names of objects that reside in schemas (tables, functions, etc.) can be schema-qualified.

objectType.description: The PostgreSQL object type to apply this security label to.

label.description: The value of the security label.

objectType.description: The PostgreSQL object type to apply this security label to.

objectType.description: The PostgreSQL object type to apply this security label to.

dropCascade.description: When true, will drop objects that depend on the server (such as user mappings), and in turn all objects that depend on those objects . (Default: false)

fdwName.description:
The name of the foreign-data wrapper that manages the server.
Changing this value
will force the creation of a new resource as this value can only be set
when the foreign server is created.

options.description: This clause specifies the options for the server. The options typically define the connection details of the server, but the actual names and values are dependent on the server's foreign-data wrapper.

serverName.description: The name of the foreign server to be created.

serverOwner.description: By default, the user who defines the server becomes its owner. Set this value to configure the new owner of the foreign server.

serverType.description:
Optional server type, potentially useful to foreign-data wrappers.
Changing this value
will force the creation of a new resource as this value can only be set
when the foreign server is created.

serverVersion.description: Optional server version, potentially useful to foreign-data wrappers.

dropCascade.description: When true, will drop objects that depend on the server (such as user mappings), and in turn all objects that depend on those objects . (Default: false)

will force the creation of a new resource as this value can only be set
when the foreign server is created.

conninfo.description: The connection string to the publisher. It should follow the [keyword/value format](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/libpq-connect.html#LIBPQ-CONNSTRING)

createSlot.description: Specifies whether the command should create the replication slot on the publisher. Default behavior is true

database.description: Which database to create the subscription on. Defaults to provider database.

name.description: The name of the publication.

publications.description: Names of the publications on the publisher to subscribe to

slotName.description: Name of the replication slot to use. The default behavior is to use the name of the subscription for the slot name

conninfo.description: The connection string to the publisher. It should follow the [keyword/value format](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/libpq-connect.html#LIBPQ-CONNSTRING)

name.description: The name of the publication.

publications.description: Names of the publications on the publisher to subscribe to

conninfo.description: The connection string to the publisher. It should follow the [keyword/value format](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/libpq-connect.html#LIBPQ-CONNSTRING)

createSlot.description: Specifies whether the command should create the replication slot on the publisher. Default behavior is true

options.description: This clause specifies the options of the user mapping. The options typically define the actual user name and password of the mapping. Option names must be unique. The allowed option names and values are specific to the server's foreign-data wrapper.

serverName.description:
The name of an existing server for which the user mapping is to be created.
Changing this value
will force the creation of a new resource as this value can only be set
when the user mapping is created.

userName.description:
The name of an existing user that is mapped to foreign server. CURRENT_ROLE, CURRENT_USER, and USER match the name of the current user. When PUBLIC is specified, a so-called public mapping is created that is used when no user-specific mapping is applicable.
Changing this value
will force the creation of a new resource as this value can only be set
when the user mapping is created.

options.description: This clause specifies the options of the user mapping. The options typically define the actual user name and password of the mapping. Option names must be unique. The allowed option names and values are specific to the server's foreign-data wrapper.

serverName.description:
The name of an existing server for which the user mapping is to be created.
Changing this value
will force the creation of a new resource as this value can only be set
when the user mapping is created.

userName.description:
The name of an existing user that is mapped to foreign server. CURRENT_ROLE, CURRENT_USER, and USER match the name of the current user. When PUBLIC is specified, a so-called public mapping is created that is used when no user-specific mapping is applicable.
Changing this value
will force the creation of a new resource as this value can only be set
when the user mapping is created.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering UserMapping resources.

serverName.description:
The name of an existing server for which the user mapping is to be created.
Changing this value
will force the creation of a new resource as this value can only be set
when the user mapping is created.

userName.description:
The name of an existing user that is mapped to foreign server. CURRENT_ROLE, CURRENT_USER, and USER match the name of the current user. When PUBLIC is specified, a so-called public mapping is created that is used when no user-specific mapping is applicable.
Changing this value
will force the creation of a new resource as this value can only be set
when the user mapping is created.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getSchemas.

database.description: The PostgreSQL database which will be queried for schema names.

includeSystemSchemas.description: Determines whether to include system schemas (pg_ prefix and information_schema). 'public' will always be included. Defaults to ``false``.

likeAllPatterns.description: List of expressions which will be pattern matched in the query using the PostgreSQL ``LIKE ALL`` operators.

likeAnyPatterns.description: List of expressions which will be pattern matched in the query using the PostgreSQL ``LIKE ANY`` operators.

notLikeAllPatterns.description: List of expressions which will be pattern matched in the query using the PostgreSQL ``NOT LIKE ALL`` operators.

regexPattern.description:
Expression which will be pattern matched in the query using the PostgreSQL ``~`` (regular expression match) operator.

Note that all optional arguments can be used in conjunction.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getSchemas.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

schemas.description: A list of full names of found schemas.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getSequences.

database.description: The PostgreSQL database which will be queried for sequence names.

likeAllPatterns.description: List of expressions which will be pattern matched against sequence names in the query using the PostgreSQL ``LIKE ALL`` operators.

likeAnyPatterns.description: List of expressions which will be pattern matched against sequence names in the query using the PostgreSQL ``LIKE ANY`` operators.

notLikeAllPatterns.description: List of expressions which will be pattern matched against sequence names in the query using the PostgreSQL ``NOT LIKE ALL`` operators.

regexPattern.description:
Expression which will be pattern matched against sequence names in the query using the PostgreSQL ``~`` (regular expression match) operator.

Note that all optional arguments can be used in conjunction.

schemas.description: List of PostgreSQL schema(s) which will be queried for sequence names. Queries all schemas in the database by default.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getSequences.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

sequences.description:
A list of PostgreSQL sequences retrieved by this data source. Each sequence consists of the fields documented below.
___

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getTables.

database.description: The PostgreSQL database which will be queried for table names.

likeAllPatterns.description: List of expressions which will be pattern matched against table names in the query using the PostgreSQL ``LIKE ALL`` operators.

likeAnyPatterns.description: List of expressions which will be pattern matched against table names in the query using the PostgreSQL ``LIKE ANY`` operators.

notLikeAllPatterns.description: List of expressions which will be pattern matched against table names in the query using the PostgreSQL ``NOT LIKE ALL`` operators.

regexPattern.description:
Expression which will be pattern matched against table names in the query using the PostgreSQL ``~`` (regular expression match) operator.

Note that all optional arguments can be used in conjunction.

schemas.description: List of PostgreSQL schema(s) which will be queried for table names. Queries all schemas in the database by default.

tableTypes.description: List of PostgreSQL table types which will be queried for table names. Includes all table types by default (including views and temp tables). Use 'BASE TABLE' for normal tables only.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getTables.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

tables.description:
A list of PostgreSQL tables retrieved by this data source. Each table consists of the fields documented below.
___
